page.title: 02Ecology Giggleswick Parish
page.content:
See slide B
Footpaths seem to have originated from connecting farms with one another.A green road/old drove road/ goes over Craven Ridge(slide 1), which splits to serve local farms. Natural History.This flatter land between the Yorkshire Dales and Bowland,Lancashire is the route for migrating birds.The area is used for grazing sheep and cattle so wild flowers thrive only on road verges.A small plantation of conifers is situated between Routster and Wham. A few trees are found sheltering homesteads. Weather. Being on west side of the Pennines, it is wet and windy. Winters are cold. When it snows drifting occurs.
